info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 7:45AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Pope, east central Hardin, Henderson, Caldwell, north central Trigg, Hopkins, Lyon, western Daviess, Muhlenberg, Livingston, Crittenden, McLean, Union and Webster Counties through 830 AM CDT... At 745 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Chandler to Henderson to Corydon to near Sturgis to near Burna. Movement was southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Henderson and Corydon around 750 AM CDT. Clay, Salem and Robards around 755 AM CDT. Sebree and Creswell around 800 AM CDT. Providence, St. Joseph, Beech Grove and Stanley around 805 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Owensboro, Eddyville, Olney, Dawson Springs, Calhoun, Madisonville, Earlington, Livermore, Nortonville and Mortons Gap. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 31 and 57. Interstate 69 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 68 and 148. Interstate 69 in Indiana between Mile Markers 1 and 2. Western Kentucky Parkway between Mile Markers 39 and 64. Pennyrile Parkway between Mile Markers 31 and 34. Audubon Parkway between Mile Markers 1 and 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for southern Illinois...southwestern Indiana...and northwestern Kentucky.
